title: Proprietary and PHI considerations
Proprietary and PHI considerations
OHDSI HSIG
text:
Proper mapping of NDC code requires an 11-digit number in a 5-4-2 format. Converting NDC from a 10-digit to an 11-digit format requires a strategically placed zero, dependent upon the 10-digit format.
All dashes need to be removed before matching to the concept.concept_code

Welcome to OHDSI Health Systems Interest Group
The Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics (or OHDSI, pronounced “Odyssey”) program is a multi-stakeholder, interdisciplinary collaborative to bring out the value of health data through large-scale analytics. All our solutions are open-source.
OHDSI’s mission - To improve health by empowering a community to collaboratively generate the evidence that promotes better health decisions and better care.
Healthcare Systems Interest Group mission - To help each other and learn from experience. Our group mainly supports health systems, hospitals, and others who have electronic health record (EHR) data on their OHDSI journey to produce reliable, reproducible evidence.
The Health Systems group meets every other Monday at 10am Eastern Time. Please join us on the MS Teams call

title: OHDSI HSIG
text: The HSIG continues to flesh out the requirements for how collaborators can best share their semantic mappings. If you would like to contribute to this effort, please join one of our meetings, post a message to our chat in MS Teams or reach out to Melanie Philofsky.

title: About
text:
Healthcare Systems Interest Group mission is to help each other and learn from experience.
Our group mainly supports Healthcare systems, hospitals, and others who have electronic health records that provide clinical care for their patients.
